metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7454 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference in XFAForm::scanFields in XFAForm.cc in xpdf 4.00 allows attackers to launch denial of service via a specific pdf file, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler73 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> code isn't in poppler

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
poppler package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-1ubuntu1').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
